title: Messed up match making?
body: Is it just me or is Riots match making really messed up, i've constantly been getting bronze plays in my games and i'm silver 1 and my mmr is fine. You really need to do something about this its ruining games and making people drop ranks. It just ruins games when you get bronzies who are constantly just feeding and losing games.

replies.body:
I went through your match history and I can see no bronzes. A few S5-4, but that's pretty normal considering its the start of season and everything is still settling while everyone gets placed.

Just because people do bad in that one game you have with them, doesn't mean they don't belong at the rank they are. Low elo players are notorious for being inconsistent af with their plays, and it is not uncommon to see a player go 15-1 one game and 2-12 the next. You likely do the same.
silver is not low elo its average 50% of the player base is silver and way less are bronze technically number wise only bronze is low elo

> [{quoted}](name=Örnn Bot,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=ABEL1PNA,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2018-01-31T20:12:38.051+0000)
>
> silver is not low elo its average 50% of the player base is silver and way less are bronze technically number wise only bronze is low elo

low elo is a subjective topic. For me everyone under diamond 2 is low elo in oce.

I think what they mean is their last years rank was bronze. They had a boosted tahm kench one game (boosted to gold 5 season 7), and a feeding lee sin which is typical for low elo, and a bronze morgana.

yeah I'm getting the same thing. if I smash my farm and have a great KDA I get first pick the next game then the following
- counter picked
- jgler that will not help my lane
- mid laner that stays mid until theyre at our nexsus 
- adc spam pinging their support
- support roaming around forcing bad fights mid and cementing us being so far behind. {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

That's not a matchmaking issue. 

That's an issue with people in your elo having particular play styles and behaviors that will keep them there. Once you have played a decent amount of games (usually around 100) the impact of these players on your games becomes negligible.
